comments.body: The original author information is incorrect, so I just modify it at dbcd020.

@linemma why the total time for running this test only costed 453.56 seconds ?

we have sleep(1) for both create/remove vlan, if there're 4k vlans, the total time shall be different.

@stcheng sorry, I forgot to update the test time on final version. 453.56 seconds is the test time on first commit.

At first commit, I add an option parameter in create_vlan and remove_vlan to skip sleep when running test_AddMaxVlan. And after creating or removing vlan, call time.sleep to wait some time.

```
        # create max vlan
        vlan = min_vid
        while vlan <= max_vid:
            self.create_vlan(str(vlan), 0)
            vlan += 1
        time.sleep(150)

        # remove all vlan
        vlan = min_vid
        while vlan <= max_vid:
            self.remove_vlan(str(vlan), 0)
            vlan += 1
        time.sleep(200)
```

But the sleep time seems not enough on Jenkins. So I modify the sleep code to original behavior at 2nd commit.

If the clear was performed by CLI, we would not face this issue. 

I remember that since the watermarkorch is supposed to clear the values on telemetry timer, it was decided to reuse the logic for user clear request.

Watermark is the only feature that really assigns zero to fields in the DB on clear event.
This is a lot of operations, and we want this to complete as quickly as possible.
I suspect that C++ will do it faster, but I didn't check)

latestReviews.body: It is an indication that it is better to clear directly from the CLI rather than relegate to the watermarkorch to do it?

reviews.body: It is an indication that it is better to clear directly from the CLI rather than relegate to the watermarkorch to do it?

comments.body: Since scapy 2.4.1 version, the "who_has" member in ARP class was removed.  As we moved to 2.4.2 version, op='who-has' is the only choice, this is also backwards compatible as this enum was there even with the old version.
@JaredLius , there is a VS test failure for test_crm.py::test_CrmAcl FAILED . Can you check and fix this?
Just to highlight, there will be now two copies of ARP requests forwarded. One flooded by ASIC and other forwarded by kernel. There is no functional impact but a minor behavioral change.
this is used for warm reboot only, so we should only do the change before warm reboot, and change it back after warm reboot.

This question is not on the PR per se. There are two sources that will set a TABLE in COUNTERS_DB, one from user/timer clear command and the other from the flex counter thread lus script execution. In this case, does redis provide a lock mechanism internally to ensure mutual exclusion on writing to a table? Also @qiluo-msft for insights
@wendani if the Redis written by single transactions, they are mutual exclusive.

Synced offline with Qi. A single transaction is in terms of a hget call or a hset call.

The watermark lua script (https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/commit/b750a4b5e4b8531cc13c250c498a2e5c26ef16f3#diff-f8446e5c7632fc3a23e06c9f9419828c) updates a value in the typical 'read-modify-write' fashion as hget-compare-hset. A user or a timer clear, either directly issued through CLI or delegated to WatermarkOrch via the APPL_DB event channel, runs in a different context from the syncd flex counter thread. If the user clears the value in between the hget and hset, we can have a race condition situation.

One thing we can do in the lua script is to have a value's hset call follow as close as possible to its hget call, rather than hgetting all three values and then hsetting all three values if any update is needed. This may helping reduce the time interval between hget and hset, at least not introducing any more delay between the two operations, and alleviate the problem to some extent.
@wendani I can enhance the lua script in separate PR.
@wendani the changes in the Lux script should go with the PR or a seperate PR? anything else from this PR is missing?
@wendani  Just doublechecked, updated the PR message. Ready to merge

latestReviews.body:
Approve on the condition that it is verified on mlnx dut before merge:
1. telemetry timer is auto rearmed
2. change of telemetry interval
3. enable/disable watermark polling, telemetry timer is started/stopped
